intro: Rotheca aurantiaca f. aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange rotheca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces bright orange to red flowers, which are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Its foliage is typically lance-shaped and emits a mild, aromatic scent.
